column1: I have here a knife. It was given me by a friend
column2: a token of his affection and esteem
column3: when I went aboard the steamer in Manila
column5: to return to the homeland. All these years since then the knife has been on my study desk
column6: daily teaching me. What lessons does this knife teach?First of all the knife tells me of Strength. The most important part of this knife is what I call the backbone. It is the main portion of the knife to which all the blades are fastened
column7: as well as the polished pearl handle. This would be a weak and useless knife did it not have a backbone. It says to me every day "Be strong
column11: Discipline. This knife has been subjected to many trials and tests. The steel of which these blades are made had to go through a hard
column13: trying process before they were tempered and fit to take an edge and hold it. Sometimes I rebel about certain processes of the days
column14: then I think of my knife and learn from it the lesson of discipline.
